manual.title: Utilization Manual
manual.p1.title: What's Hosting
manual.p1_3: service is provided by MiNET, it allows its members to create Virtual Machines and to store it within the servers of the association.
manual.p2.title: What's a VM ?
manual.p2_1: A Virtual Machine (VM), is 'the client' created by an IT environment, 'the host'. Many virtual machines can coexist with the same host. The main files that constitute a virtual machine are : a journal file, a setting file for RAM, a virtual disk file and a configuration file. -
manual.p3.title: Why would I use a VM ?
manual.p3_1_1: A VM can be used as a storage area, a sandbox to make development tests, a hosting platform for websites...
manual.p3_1_2: The only limit is your imagination.
manual.p4.title: How can I create a VM ?
manual.p4_1: The MiNET Hosting service allows you to create a VM in just a few clicks. You must firstly enter your MiNET credentials in the 'Login' tab.
manual.p4_2: In the 'Your VMs' tab, you may start to create your VM, by entering the name of your VM, choosing the possibility to configure an SSH Key-Based Authentication, and credentials (username/password) for the user in your VM (avoid 'root' as a username in order not to face conflicts).
manual.p4_3: The created VM has technicals aspects which depends of the template used. It's possible to change these characteristics by contacting the MiNET team with justification.
manual.p4_5.title: Bare VM
manual.p4_5.description: : creates a fully customizable VM. It's the default model, that contains openssh, fail2ban, and the class debian packages.
manual.p4_6.title: Static web server
manual.p4_6.description: : creates a VM with a ready for use web server (Wordpress).
manual.p4_7_1: Once your registration form is filled
manual.p4_7_2: you must wait a few minutes
manual.p4_7_3: depending on the template you've chose, for your VM to be created.
manual.p4_8_1: You can access your VM through the 'Your VMs' tab.
manual.p4_8_2: Your VM IP adress will be in the subnet 157.159.195.0/24
manual.p4_9: Warning : you can't create more than 3 VMs
manual.p5.title: How can I generate ssh keys ?
manual.p5_1: The ssh connection with keys is mandatory. It is far more safe than using password.
manual.p5_2_4: We strongly advice you to protect your keys with a passphrase, as suggested by the command prompt
manual.p5_2_5: Copy the key which is saved in the file
manual.p5_2.7: Paste your public key in the VM creation form on hosting.
manual.p5_2_8: WARNING : Be sure to select the key ending with
manual.p5_2_10: ! The other is your private key. It must remains private !
manual.p6.title: What should I do after my VM is up ?
manual.p6_1_1: You can firstly connect to your VM. There are two ways :
manual.p6_1_2: via your shell, by executing the command
manual.p6_1_5: via the openssh tool, that is directly incorporated on our website, that allows you to connect to the VM through your browser. You'll then have to enter the IP address of your VM and its credentials.
manual.p7.title: Why would I use a DNS entry ?
manual.p7_1_1: A DNS allows to associate a clear name to an IP address. -
manual.p7_2_1: In the 'MiNET DNS entries' tab, you can choose to add an address to your website, it will look like :
manual.p7_3_1: You simply have to write the name you want to use and the IP of your server.
manual.p7_3_2: You will therefore be allowed to access your site through the DNS entry.
manual.p7_4: To obtain an HTTPS certification, launch the script : /opt/certbot.sh your_domain_name inside your VM.
manual.p7_5_1: If you have any follow-up questions or if you face a problem, you can contact us on
